result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Henke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Stayed - Huber if approved by Jail Administration

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $875 .00.

Bond applied to restitution.  Pay costs and DNA Surcharge and balance of restitution.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Maintain full time employment until restitution is paid, then can go to school if Defendant wishes to.
Engage in any other counseling as recommended by the agent.
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations if there are any.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J Henke in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Michael J Henke in custody.  Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:08 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances. 

This matter is set for a plea today.

There is a plea agreeement.
Defendant is pleading to Count 1.
Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: 943.01(1)
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Victim was given notification, no one appears.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Restitution summary is handed to the Court.
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 90 Days, Imposed and Stayed
3 Days Jail Credit
Huber if approved by jail administration
Probation for a period of 12 Months
Conditions:
Pay restitution in the amount of $875 
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Maintain full time employment until restitution is paid, then can go to school if Defendant wishes to
Engage in any other counseling as recommended by the agent
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations if there are any

Bond shall be applied to restitution first, balance to be paid on probation.
Appeal rights are addressed.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus /s/TTF 04-02-15

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-24-2015 01:00 pm

Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:59 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Kryshak makes statements.  Defendant was sentenced to jail of 6 months in January.  May be in custody in Wood County or Waupaca County.  Asks to reschedule the matter to find his client. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Henke in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
